1.text: Then answered Eliphaz the Temanite, and said:

2.text: Can a man be profitable unto God? Or can he that is wise be profitable unto Him?

3.text: Is it any advantage to the Almighty, that thou art righteous? Or is it gain to Him, that thou makest thy ways blameless?

4.text: Is it for thy fear of Him that He reproveth thee, That He entereth with thee into judgment?

5.text: Is not thy wickedness great? And are not thine iniquities without end?

6.text: For thou hast taken pledges of thy brother for nought, And stripped the naked of their clothing.

7.text: Thou hast not given water to the weary to drink, And thou hast withholden bread from the hungry.

8.text: And as a mighty man, who hath the earth, And as a man of rank, who dwelleth in it,

9.text: Thou hast sent widows away empty, And the arms of the fatherless have been broken.

10.text: Therefore snares are round about thee, And sudden dread affrighted thee,

11.text: Or darkness, that thou canst not see, And abundance of waters cover thee.

12.text: Is not God in the height of heaven? And behold the topmost of the stars, how high they are!

13.text: And thou sayest: ‘What doth God know? Can He judge through the dark cloud?

14.text: Thick clouds are a covering to Him, that He seeth not; And He walketh in the circuit of heaven.’

15.text: Wilt thou keep the old way Which wicked men have trodden?

16.text: Who were snatched away before their time, Whose foundation was poured out as a stream;

17.text: Who said unto God: ‘Depart from us’; And what could the Almighty do unto them?

18.text: Yet He filled their houses with good things—But the counsel of the wicked is far from me.

19.text: The righteous saw it, and were glad, And the innocent laugh them to scorn:

20.text: Surely their substance is cut off, And their abundance the fire hath consumed.’

21.text: Acquaint now thyself with Him, and be at peace; Thereby shall thine increase be good.

22.text: Receive, I pray thee, instruction from His mouth, And lay up His words in thy heart.

23.text: If thou return to the Almighty, thou shalt be built up—If thou put away unrighteousness far from thy tents,

24.text: And lay thy treasure in the dust, And the gold of Ophir among the stones of the brooks;

25.text: And the Almighty be thy treasure, And precious silver unto thee;

26.text: Then surely shalt thou have thy delight in the Almighty, And shalt lift up thy face unto God.

27.text: Thou shalt make thy prayer unto Him, and He will hear thee, And thou shalt pay thy vows;

28.text: Thou shalt also decree a thing, and it shall be established unto thee, And light shall shine upon thy ways.

29.text: When they cast thee down, thou shalt say: ‘There is lifting up’; For the humble person He saveth.

30.text: He delivereth him that is innocent, Yea, thou shalt be delivered through the cleanness of thy hands.
